author: mikesnewname
content: Is it working yet. I had been trying for days and continuously getting this. I have 100's of transactions on mainnet. Someone mentioned it may have been a bug. just checking if i should try again now

author: skylenet
content:
It‚Äôs a known bug. There‚Äôs currently a problem which makes your login session invalid if your browser fails to query the sequencer once. This is not intended and should hopefully be fixed soon. 

Right now you need to make sure that your internet connection is very stable and that your computer never goes to sleep. I‚Äôve also noticed that some browsers reduce activity if your screen is locked, so might be also worth it to keep the screen unlocked.

But IMO, the best would be to wait for the fix.

author: mikesnewname
content: Thanks alot man, i'm gonna wait it out then. good to know its a known issue

author: ulerdogan
content:

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> are you sure you participated with that address? did you download a contribution receipt (`data.json`) at the end of the process?

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> also when on "the first day" because the ceremony only started at 13:13 UTC and many contributed before then (and got deleted because of it).

author: ulerdogan
content:
Yes, I checked my address from the template tweet and it's at 1.08 pm UTC. It might be before than the main start. I don't have the json file. Thanks.

Why did it has restarted at 13.13? Was the first one a test?

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: My contribution also got lost by the restart :(

author: bridge-bot
content:
<CarlBeek> Ok, glad we got to the bottom of that. I hope you'll contribute again when you have some free time. üëç also good on you for checking that your contribution is included in the ceremony, these kinds of checks are important to verify the ceremony ran correctly.

the launch time was always set to 13:13 UTC on the 13th. I liked the meme of all the 13's. unfortunately this got lost in communication to a few people along the way and they excited started announcing "ceremony start" before that was actually the case
